content.description:
Technical beta mixed with a hint of height dependency (please prove me wrong on this) make for a fun romp up this short wall. Route goes up the center of the wall pulling the roof on protruding rock along the lip. Wingspan starts with a scramble up to the base of the triangle-shaped boulder. Play with the roof a bit and try not to think about the boulder underneath you. Burly moves get you past the lip and a thin finish on the mini-wave earns the anchors. Don't z-clip the 2nd bolt.  

  Belayer should stand down and to the right just under bolt 1 to minimize rope issues at the start. 

  R rating due to possible bad landing on boulder. Have a good belayer and a cool head @ bolt 4 and you'll be fine. Do not toprope this route. A bad fall onto the pointed boulder below can (did) happen. 

  During development while working the roof section my right hand popped out of the slot causing me to take a grounder onto the slanted boulder below. I struck at just the right angle as to not incur any injuries but I wouldn't say by any means that the feat is repeatable. DON'T TOP ROPE THIS ROUTE.
content.location: Center of Buzzard's roof. Look for the slanted triangle-shaped boulder. Route goes up and over the lip of the roof on a large block.

content.description:
Starts on the staircase of ledges to the right of Fiscal Cliff. Goes up to the crack formed by the roof and the wall and then to the right of the arete formed by the roof and wall. Finish at the two trees (for now?) 

  Route still has some loose rocks both large and small to be removed so be careful what you grab and where you step. Also some vegetation is hiding good features. Some pencil cactus is on the route so watch out for that too. 

  I would consider the last moves to the trees the crux based on awkwardness, so get really good protection in before that. A fall while trying to reach the trees would be very shitty. Don't do it. There are some very nice crimps around and pre-plan where you are putting your feet. You are on a great ledge before the this so you have plenty of time to look and feel around before committing to anything. 

  Still requires some cleaning. 

  Reimer's Ranch does not have enough traditional routes.
content.protection:
Small cams such as a set of black through red aliens plus a few C4s such as 0.5 - 1 and some small to medium nuts is a good start. Tricams may be good. Sling the two trees up top for an anchor now, belay your second up, then top out taking your anchor materials with you. 

  My first pieces were at the crack formed by the roof and wall. Don't put protection behind the flakes or large loose rocks throughout the climb.
content.location:
Right of Fiscal Cliff. Starts on the "staircase" of ledges and then up to the right of the arete formed by the roof. 

  Top out, then rap back down on one of the easier sport climbs to the left where the sport anchors are easily reachable by laying on your stomach.

content.description: This route starts on the ground (not on the boulder you cheater) and pulls the mini roof. Pulling the roof seems to be the crux for most people.
content.location: Left side of buzzards roof. Route starts in the tight path just after the small step up to the right of a small boulder. Don't use the boulder to start the route - this wall is short enough as it is!

content.description: Pulls the roof, slightly left of the roof's arete. The grade could be as high as 5.12a. For now I've split the difference between Rupesh & Marisa's 5.11c opinion and a few 5.12a opinions.
content.protection: 4 bolts and anchors. Consider stick-clipping bolts 1-2 due to the low landing.
content.location: Farthest right route on the wall.

content.description:
Bound to Divide is a great warm up for the area and will test a 5.8 climber's ability with a good variety of climbing packed into such a short route. Thin edges at the bottom, juggly ledges in the middle and a flake system up top. Route starts from the ground and goes up just left of the roof.  

  Human stick clip the first bolt by standing on the bolder stack just behind the route.
content.location: Start from the ground where the path is.

content.description: A fun, short but surprisingly pumpy route. Begin in the white chossy looking section.
content.location: Near the left end of Buzzard's Roof.

content.description:
Buzzards Roof is the small roof area to the left of "Undead Cats" wall and just to the right of "Little Guides" wall. Routes are short and fun with nearly all of them including a roof pull. 

  Morning and afternoon shade. Late afternoon low sun.  

  Keep an eye out for the two large buzzards that call the area home.
